bug.short_desc: github2spec crashes because of lacking / wrong filesystem permissions
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
$ gofed github2spec --project=rjeczalik --repo=notify --with-build
Repo URL: github.com/rjeczalik/notify Commit: 9d5aa0c3b735c3340018a4627446c3ea5a04a097 Name: golang-github-rjeczalik-notify
(1/4) Checking if the package already exists in PkgDB (2/4) Collecting data 2017-02-25 20:23:04,578 - ERROR - [Errno 13] Permission denied: '/var/lib/gofed/resource_provider/githubsourcecodeprovider-8c418aa1ece4419e8753a28fac7a94d765e733d34a3e4150ac624b8d8aba546f'
Marking the directories in question as writable for $(whoami) fixes the issue, but that's not really a workable solution for what I suspect to be a bug ... (and no, my filesystem isn't corrupted, I checked everything with $(rpm -Va), and there's no issues for gofed stuff).
Affected version: gofed-1.0.0-0.7.rc1.fc25.x86_64
Is your user in gofed group?

No. Adding myself to the group fixes the crash.
I checked, and having to add the current user to the gofed group isn't documented anywhere. So mentioning this step on fedora's golang packaging wiki page would probably be a good idea ...
Meantime, here https://github.com/gofed/gofed/blob/master/demo.pdf are slides from this year DevConf with basic info about the tool.

Just providing a man page "man gofed" that provides the information user running the gofed command need to be a member of gofed group.
Later, all the man pages should be generated automatically. Till that time providing the simplest man page.
